title: Aokiji Let Akainu Win the Duel
summary: Some fans theorize that Aokiji intentionally lost the battle for Fleet Admiral to Akainu because he had a different plan - to infiltrate the underworld and work against deeper threats to the world.
fullText: When Episode 582 revealed that Akainu and Aokiji fought for ten days on Punk Hazard, many fans began theorizing about the true nature of their battle. The theory suggests that Aokiji, knowing Akainu would become Fleet Admiral anyway due to World Government preference, deliberately lost the fight to gain freedom from the Marines. This allowed him to later join Blackbeard's crew as a spy or work independently against larger threats. The ten-day duration suggests relatively equal power levels, making it suspicious that Akainu achieved such a decisive victory. Aokiji's later appearances working with the underworld support this theory.
author: Reddit User: MarineSecrets

source.title: Theory: Aokiji Deliberately Lost to Akainu

title: Caesar Clown's Connection to Vegapunk's Experiment
summary: The revelation in Episode 582 about Vegapunk's failed chemical weapons experiment four years ago led to theories that Caesar Clown was actually responsible for the disaster, not Vegapunk.
fullText: When Smoker mentions that Punk Hazard was abandoned after a failed chemical weapons experiment by Vegapunk four years prior, many fans immediately theorized that Caesar Clown was the real culprit. The theory suggests that Caesar, working under Vegapunk at the time, either caused the accident through recklessness or deliberately sabotaged the experiment. This would explain why Caesar later returns to Punk Hazard to continue his experiments - he's familiar with the facility and knows it's abandoned. It also provides motivation for the rivalry between Caesar and Vegapunk. Later episodes confirm elements of this theory.
author: Forum User: SciencePirate

source.title: Caesar's Role in Punk Hazard Disaster

title: The Giant Children Connect to Elbaf
summary: The discovery of Caesar's experiments to create giant children in Episode 582 sparked theories about a larger conspiracy to create artificial giants, possibly connected to the World Government's interest in the giant kingdom of Elbaf.
fullText: When the Straw Hats discover the giant children in Episode 582, fans immediately connected this to earlier mentions of the World Government's attempts to create giants. The theory proposes that Caesar's experiments are part of a larger World Government project to create giant soldiers, possibly to counter the natural giants of Elbaf or to create a controllable giant army. This connects to the ancient giant experiments mentioned in earlier arcs and suggests a deeper conspiracy involving the World Government, Vegapunk, and Caesar. The children's tragic situation may foreshadow the crew's eventual journey to Elbaf and confrontation with those who experiment on children.
author: YouTube Theorist: GrandFleetTheories

source.title: The Giant Children Conspiracy - Punk Hazard to Elbaf

title: Punk Hazard's Climate as a Permanent Awakening Effect
summary: The permanent climate change on Punk Hazard revealed in Episode 582 led to theories about Devil Fruit Awakening and whether Akainu and Aokiji's battle demonstrated awakened abilities.
fullText: The revelation that Punk Hazard remains permanently divided between fire and ice two years after the Akainu vs Aokiji battle sparked intense discussion about Devil Fruit Awakening. Fans theorized that both admirals must have used awakened Devil Fruit abilities during their fight, as the environmental effects are permanent rather than temporary. This would mean awakened Logia-type fruits can permanently alter the environment, similar to how awakened Paramecia types affect their surroundings. The theory suggests that the ten-day battle pushed both fighters to awaken their fruits, and the lasting climate change proves that Admiral-level combatants have mastered awakening. This became particularly relevant when later episodes confirmed Devil Fruit Awakening as a real phenomenon.
author: Forum User: DevilFruitScholar
